content:
Side dish: Onion salan Servings: 6 Duration: 30 mins Salan means " curry " it's a gravy curry and semi liquid consistency this is one of the most popular side dish for Vegetables Biryani in Hyderabad, India üáÆüá≥ I clearly remember famous Biryani Center is Paradise Biryani in Hyderabad, India. They serve vegetable Dum Biryani with Mirchi ka Salan/ Onion Salan which enhances your Biryani to the next level. Onion Salan is a gravy curry, it contains fried onions, peanuts, sesame seeds, coconut powder, tamarind pulp, spices and more Today I prepared most popular and relishing Hyderabad - "Onion Salan" I hope you like it.. Let's start with Ingredients and follows Procedure Ingredients:
  • Onions - 2 - Medium - Slices
  • Peanuts - 80 gms
  • Sesame seeds - 30 gms
  • Dry coconut powder/ desiccated Coconut - 2 tb sp
  • Ginger- Garlic Paste - 1 tb sp
  • Tamarind extract - 2 tb sp - soaked in 400 ml water
  • Turmeric powder - 1/4 tsp
  • Red chilly powder - 2 tsp
  • Cumin powder - 1 tb sp
  • Coriander powder - 1 tb sp
  • Salt - 1/2 tb sp
  • Water - 1 ltr
  • Mustard seeds - 1 tsp
  • Cumin seeds - 1 tsp
  • Curry leaves - 5 to 7
  • Oil - 40 ml
Procedure: Step 1:
  • Dry roast peanuts, sesame seeds and desiccated powder till golden brown
  • Take out in a bowl & Let them become cool
  • Next blend them along with tamarind extract and water
  • Blend till smooth paste and keep aside
Step 2:
  • Heat skillet pan Add 1 tsp oil
  • Add sliced onions and fry till they turn slightly golden brown
  • Take out Onions and keep aside
Step 3:
  • Heat flat-bottomed frying pan over medium heat
  • Add oil and tempering
  • Add spices ( red chilly powder, salt, cumin powder, coriander powder, Garam Masala Powder, turmeric powder )
  • Blended paste
  • Stir occasionally and cook 15 mins
  • When it started boiling Add fried onions and adjust consistency by adding water
  • Cook more 10-12 mins till oil oozes out
  • Onion salan is ready to serve
  • Happy cooking & enjoy your day üôÇ
